incidents.name: Increased Control Plane Error Rate for Multiple Services

incident_updates.body: Network connectivity losses on Cloudflare's internal network resulted in approximately 5 minutes of elevated error rates for control plane operations on some services, from 2025-08-07 16:39:25 UTC to 2025-08-07 16:40:45 UTC.

incident_updates.body:
Cloudflare observed and fixed an issue which potentially impacted multiple users on 1.1.1.1 public resolver,  in all regions. A higher latency than usual would have been observed.

The impact occurred on  2025-08-01, from 14:03 to 19:23 UTC.

The issue is resolved now.

incidents.name: Cloudflare Pages: Compression issues with custom hostnames

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Cloudflare has identified an issue with our Pages feature: Customers under our Free plan using custom hostnames may experience specific pages unexpectedly returning zstd compression mode. Customers experiencing this issue can add a compression rule to enforce brotli or gzip compression to temporarily circumvent the problem. Nevertheless, we are working to mitigate this issue, more updates to follow shortly.

incidents.name: Elevated number of 522 errors in South America

incident_updates.body: Between 00:23-00:31 UTC, customers reaching some South American datacenters (GIG, EZE and SCL) would have experienced an elevated number of 522 errors due to a fibre cut in the region. Traffic has been rerouted from the impacted path.
This incident has been resolved.

incident_updates.body: Every impacted device has now self-healed. This incident has been resolved.

WARP Devices that were rebooted, registered, or rotated keys between July 22 2025 17:25 UTC and July 22 2025 20:00pm are impacted by this incident. The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
